answers.answer: I was having severe pain on the right side of my head...horrible headaches, sinusitis-like pain, jaw & tooth pain, neck pain.  I have unrelated Peripheral Neuropathy in my feet (usually connected to Diabetes which I don't have) which feels like I'm walking on burning coals, broken glass and razor blades.  I asked my Dr. if there was such a thing as Neuropathy of the face and head.  He said yes, it's called Trigeminal Neuralgia which affects one side of the head (could be right or left).  He put me on a seizure medication, Tegretol, which has been used effectively on Trigeminal Neuralgia.  Within two days of taking this medication the pain was about 90% gone.  I have other medical issues going on but it was a huge relief to get rid of the kind of pain you're talking about.  Check it out.  Hope this helps.Check it out.

question: Ok here it is I have been having left-sided headaches for about 3 months now....and yes I have been to the Dr. several times only to have them giving me antibiotics for sinuses. I do have fluid on my left ear and have had pain above and behind that ear ( in the head) and also in my left temple. But every now and then my neck will hurt and the back of my head..and it almost feels swollen on the left side and it feels funny when I shake my head, and it all started when my sinuses acted up about 3 months ago followed by the fluid on the ear then headaches. Please help...has anyone had this happen to them?? I have had a CT scan a little over a year ago and nothing showed up..and in a week I am going to have an MRI . I really am desperate to find out what this is......Thanks
title: Left-sided headaches
